intro: Onosma trapezuntea, commonly known as the Balkan sandthrift, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, blue to violet flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are typically hairy and arranged in opposite pairs along the stems. Onosma trapezuntea is adapted to rocky and well-drained soils, often found in alpine and subalpine environments.
